body:
It won't help in most of the cases, but also doesn't hurt. Basically, whenever something can be constexpr, I'm making it constexpr ;)

Its concrete effect here is to enforce that if you have a "constexpr TypeMeta" somewhere, you can call itemsize() at compile time. You're likely not going to get constexpr TypeMeta instances, so it doesn't really matter.
